definition: as a lotus flower breaking the surface (idiom); surpassingly beautiful (of young lady's face or old gentleman's calligraphy)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
see 芙蓉[fu2 rong2], lotus
short name for Chengdu 成都[Cheng2 du1]
see 芙蓉[fu2 rong2], lotus/food that has been minced, shredded, or ground into a paste, suitable for stuffing or making a sauce
lit. lotus rises from the water (idiom); fig. to blossom (of poem or art)
to have bright eyes and white teeth
graceful/charming/feminine
lit. fish sink, goose alights (idiom, from Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子); fig. female beauty captivating even the birds and beasts
fresh and pure
lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful/also written 傾城傾國|倾城倾国[qing1 cheng2 qing1 guo2]
pretty daughter in a humble family
lucid and elegant/quiet and exquisite/clear and attractive style
slender and elegant (of a woman)
lit. to shade in the clouds to offset the moon (idiom); fig. a foil/a contrasting character to a main hero
gentle and refined
clear as ice and clean as jade (idiom); spotless/irreproachable/incorruptible
dainty
lit. hiding the moon, shaming the flowers (idiom)/fig. female beauty exceeding even that of the natural world
clear, bright eyes (idiom)
beauty unmatched in her generation (idiom); woman of peerless elegance/prettiest girl ever
